item.description:
It's time for the annual Godard movie.  This one is supposed to be terrific.  Here's the synopsis:

 

"Film Socialisme by Jean-Luc Godard (2010, 101 min.). Legendary director Jean-Luc Godard returns to the screen with Film Socialisme, a magisterial essay on the decline of European civilization. As a garish cruise ship travels the Mediterranean (with Patti Smith among its guests), Godard embarks on a “State of the EU” address in a vibrant collage of philosophical quotes, historical revelations, and pure cinematographic beauty."

 

It's at the MFA as part of their French Film festival.  After, depending on the number of people who show up, we'll take in a local eatery.

 

If you're not familiar with Godard, you'll find that he is highly sensual and intellectual at the same time and can draw you and alienate you simultaneously- it's part of his charm.  There's always plenty to talk about after. 

 

His sense of light, color, and composition are distinctive.  He's 80 now and I'd love to see what he thinks about our civilization.  Hope you can join me.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be on the right side of the theater after the show. Before and during the show, I'll be in about the center of the 5th row.
item.name: It's time for our annual movie by Jean Luc Godard: Film Socialisme
